author: Reid J. Epstein
title: Five Questions Illinois Voters Will Answer on Tuesday
text:
WASHINGTON—The Illinois primaries on Tuesday will, in part, settle disputes for both Democrats and Republicans by defining the political cost of deviating from party orthodoxy on social issues.
Democrats will also pick candidates in five competitive House primaries—four of which are in districts where the party hopes it can dislodge an incumbent Republican in November.

Here... RELATED VIDEO Can the Democrats Ride a Blue Wave to Midterm Election Wins? The Democrats have a "blue wave" of momentum building for the 2018 midterms, thanks to a motivated base, success in special elections and a low approval rating for President Trump. Will that be enough to take back the House and the Senate?
